etymology.description: 辶(辶) (chuò, "walk") + 兔(兔) (tù, "rabbit") = rabbit running -> escape, ease
etymology.interpretation: The character 逸(yì) combines the 辶(辶) (chuò, "walk"), which signifies movement, with 兔(兔) (tù, "rabbit"), which adds the sound and also suggests the idea of a rabbit swiftly escaping. Together, they convey the notion of escaping or fleeing with ease, embodying the meanings of both leisure and escape.

examples.chinese: 他在安静的庭院中享受逸趣(他在安靜的庭院中享受逸趣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài ānjìng de tíngyuàn zhōng xiǎngshòu yìqù.
examples.english: He enjoys leisure in the quiet courtyard.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢逸居(他喜歡逸居)，远离城市喧嚣(遠離城市喧囂)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān yìjū, yuǎnlí chéngshì xuānxiāo.
examples.english: He likes to live in seclusion, away from the city's hustle and bustle.

examples.chinese: 假日来临时(假日來臨時)，他计划逸出尘嚣(他計劃逸出塵囂)。
examples.pinyin: Jiàrì láilín shí, tā jìhuà yìchū chénxiāo.
examples.english: When the holiday arrives, he plans to escape the hustle and bustle.
